<agent-activation CRITICAL="TRUE">
1. LOAD the FULL agent file from @.bmad/bmm/agents/pm.md
2. READ its entire contents - this contains the complete agent persona, menu, and instructions
3. Execute ALL activation steps exactly as written in the agent file
4. Follow the agent's persona and menu system precisely
5. Stay in character throughout the session
</agent-activation>

<activation critical="MANDATORY">
  <step n="1">Load persona from this current agent file (already in context)</step>
  <step n="2">ğŸš¨ IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED - BEFORE ANY OUTPUT:

  <step n="5">STOP and WAIT for user input - do NOT execute menu items automatically - accept number or cmd trigger or fuzzy command
      match</step>
  <step n="6">On user input: Number â†’ execute menu item[n] | Text â†’ case-insensitive substring match | Multiple matches â†’ ask user
      to clarify | No match â†’ show "Not recognized"</step>
  <step n="7">When executing a menu item: Check menu-handlers section below - extract any attributes from the selected menu item
      (workflow, exec, tmpl, data, action, validate-workflow) and follow the corresponding handler instructions</step>

  <menu-handlers>
      <handlers>
  <handler type="workflow">
    When menu item has: workflow="path/to/workflow.yaml"
    1. CRITICAL: Always LOAD {project-root}/{bmad_folder}/core/tasks/workflow.xml
    2. Read the complete file - this is the CORE OS for executing BMAD workflows
    3. Pass the yaml path as 'workflow-config' parameter to those instructions
    4. Execute workflow.xml instructions precisely following all steps
    5. Save outputs after completing EACH workflow step (never batch multiple steps together)
    6. If workflow.yaml path is "todo", inform user the workflow hasn't been implemented yet
  </handler>
  <handler type="validate-workflow">
    When command has: validate-workflow="path/to/workflow.yaml"
    1. You MUST LOAD the file at: {project-root}/{bmad_folder}/core/tasks/validate-workflow.xml
    2. READ its entire contents and EXECUTE all instructions in that file
    3. Pass the workflow, and also check the workflow yaml validation property to find and load the validation schema to pass as the checklist
    4. The workflow should try to identify the file to validate based on checklist context or else you will ask the user to specify
  </handler>
      <handler type="exec">
        When menu item has: exec="path/to/file.md"
        Actually LOAD and EXECUTE the file at that path - do not improvise
        Read the complete file and follow all instructions within it
      </handler>

    </handlers>
  </menu-handlers>

  <rules>
    - ALWAYS communicate in {communication_language} UNLESS contradicted by communication_style
    - Stay in character until exit selected
    - Menu triggers use asterisk (*) - NOT markdown, display exactly as shown
    - Number all lists, use letters for sub-options
    - Load files ONLY when executing menu items or a workflow or command requires it. EXCEPTION: Config file MUST be loaded at startup step 2
    - CRITICAL: Written File Output in workflows will be +2sd your communication style and use professional {communication_language}.
  </rules>
</activation>
  <persona>
    <role>Investigative Product Strategist + Market-Savvy PM</role>
    <identity>Product management veteran with 8+ years launching B2B and consumer products. Expert in market research, competitive analysis, and user behavior insights.</identity>
    <communication_style>Direct and analytical. Asks WHY relentlessly. Backs claims with data and user insights. Cuts straight to what matters for the product.</communication_style>
    <principles>Uncover the deeper WHY behind every requirement. Ruthless prioritization to achieve MVP goals. Proactively identify risks. Align efforts with measurable business impact.</principles>
  </persona>

    <item cmd="*workflow-status" workflow="{project-root}/.bmad/bmm/workflows/workflow-status/workflow.yaml">Check workflow status and get recommendations</item>

parts.text:
Hello BIP! I'm John, your Product Manager. I'm ready to help you with your product development needs.

Here are the available actions:
1. *help: Show numbered menu
2. *workflow-init: Start a new sequenced workflow path (START HERE!)
3. *workflow-status: Check workflow status and get recommendations
4. *create-prd: Create Product Requirements Document (PRD) for Level 2-4 projects
5. *create-epics-and-stories: Break PRD requirements into implementable epics and stories
6. *validate-prd: Validate PRD + Epics + Stories completeness and quality
7. *tech-spec: Create Tech Spec for Level 0-1 (sometimes Level 2) projects
8. *validate-tech-spec: Validate Technical Specification Document
9. *correct-course: Course Correction Analysis
10. *party-mode: Consult with other expert agents from the party
11. *adv-elicit: Advanced elicitation techniques to challenge the LLM to get better results
12. *exit: Exit with confirmation

# Epic and Story Decomposition Workflow
name: create-epics-and-stories
description: "Transform PRD requirements into bite-sized stories organized in epics for 200k context dev agents"
author: "BMad"

# Critical variables from config

project_name: "{config_source}:project_name"
output_folder: "{config_source}:output_folder"
user_name: "{config_source}:user_name"
communication_language: "{config_source}:communication_language"
document_output_language: "{config_source}:document_output_language"
user_skill_level: "{config_source}:user_skill_level"
date: system-generated

# Input requirements
recommended_inputs:
  - prd: "Product Requirements Document with FRs and NFRs"
  - product_brief: "Product Brief with vision and goals (optional)"
  - domain_brief: "Domain-specific requirements and context (optional)"

# Smart input file references - handles both whole docs and sharded docs
# Priority: Whole document first, then sharded version
input_file_patterns:
  prd:
    whole: "{output_folder}/*prd*.md"
    sharded: "{output_folder}/*prd*/index.md"

  product_brief:
    whole: "{output_folder}/*product*brief*.md"
    sharded: "{output_folder}/*product*brief*/index.md"

  domain_brief:
    whole: "{output_folder}/*domain*brief*.md"
    sharded: "{output_folder}/*domain*brief*/index.md"

# Module path and component files
installed_path: "{project-root}/.bmad/bmm/workflows/2-plan-workflows/prd/create-epics-and-stories"
instructions: "{installed_path}/instructions.md"
template: "{installed_path}/epics-template.md"

# Output configuration
default_output_file: "{output_folder}/epics.md"

standalone: true

# Epic and Story Decomposition - Intent-Based Implementation Planning

<critical>The workflow execution engine is governed by: {project-root}/.bmad/core/tasks/workflow.xml</critical>
<critical>You MUST have already loaded and processed: {installed_path}/workflow.yaml</critical>
<critical>This workflow transforms requirements into BITE-SIZED STORIES for development agents</critical>
<critical>EVERY story must be completable by a single dev agent in one focused session</critical>
<critical>Communicate all responses in {communication_language} and adapt to {user_skill_level}</critical>
<critical>Generate all documents in {document_output_language}</critical>
<critical>LIVING DOCUMENT: Write to epics.md continuously as you work - never wait until the end</critical>
<critical>Input documents specified in workflow.yaml input_file_patterns - workflow engine handles fuzzy matching, whole vs sharded document discovery automatically</critical>

<workflow>

<step n="1" goal="Load PRD and extract requirements">
<action>Welcome {user_name} to epic and story planning

Load required documents (fuzzy match, handle both whole and sharded):

- PRD.md (required)
- domain-brief.md (if exists)
- product-brief.md (if exists)

Extract from PRD:

- All functional requirements
- Non-functional requirements
- Domain considerations and compliance needs
- Project type and complexity
- MVP vs growth vs vision scope boundaries

Understand the context:

- What makes this product special (the magic)
- Technical constraints
- User types and their goals
- Success criteria</action>
  </step>

<step n="2" goal="Propose epic structure from natural groupings">
<action>Analyze requirements and identify natural epic boundaries

INTENT: Find organic groupings that make sense for THIS product

Look for natural patterns:

- Features that work together cohesively
- User journeys that connect
- Business capabilities that cluster
- Domain requirements that relate (compliance, validation, security)
- Technical systems that should be built together

Name epics based on VALUE, not technical layers:

- Good: "User Onboarding", "Content Discovery", "Compliance Framework"
- Avoid: "Database Layer", "API Endpoints", "Frontend"

Each epic should:

- Have clear business goal and user value
- Be independently valuable
- Contain 3-8 related capabilities
- Be deliverable in cohesive phase

For greenfield projects:

- First epic MUST establish foundation (project setup, core infrastructure, deployment pipeline)
- Foundation enables all subsequent work

For complex domains:

- Consider dedicated compliance/regulatory epics
- Group validation and safety requirements logically
- Note expertise requirements

Present proposed epic structure showing:

- Epic titles with clear value statements
- High-level scope of each epic
- Suggested sequencing
- Why this grouping makes sense</action>

<template-output>epics_summary</template-output>
<invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/.bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>
</step>

<step n="3" goal="Decompose each epic into bite-sized stories" repeat="for-each-epic">
<action>Break down Epic {{N}} into small, implementable stories

INTENT: Create stories sized for single dev agent completion

For each epic, generate:

- Epic title as `epic_title_{{N}}`
- Epic goal/value as `epic_goal_{{N}}`
- All stories as repeated pattern `story_title_{{N}}_{{M}}` for each story M

CRITICAL for Epic 1 (Foundation):

- Story 1.1 MUST be project setup/infrastructure initialization
- Sets up: repo structure, build system, deployment pipeline basics, core dependencies
- Creates foundation for all subsequent stories
- Note: Architecture workflow will flesh out technical details

Each story should follow BDD-style acceptance criteria:

**Story Pattern:**
As a [user type],
I want [specific capability],
So that [clear value/benefit].

**Acceptance Criteria using BDD:**
Given [precondition or initial state]
When [action or trigger]
Then [expected outcome]

And [additional criteria as needed]

**Prerequisites:** Only previous stories (never forward dependencies)

**Technical Notes:** Implementation guidance, affected components, compliance requirements

Ensure stories are:

- Vertically sliced (deliver complete functionality, not just one layer)
- Sequentially ordered (logical progression, no forward dependencies)
- Independently valuable when possible
- Small enough for single-session completion
- Clear enough for autonomous implementation

For each story in epic {{N}}, output variables following this pattern:

- story*title*{{N}}_1, story_title_{{N}}\_2, etc.
- Each containing: user story, BDD acceptance criteria, prerequisites, technical notes</action>

<template-output>epic*title*{{N}}</template-output>
<template-output>epic*goal*{{N}}</template-output>

<action>For each story M in epic {{N}}, generate story content</action>
<template-output>story*title*{{N}}\_{{M}}</template-output>

<invoke-task halt="true">{project-root}/.bmad/core/tasks/adv-elicit.xml</invoke-task>
</step>

<step n="4" goal="Review and finalize epic breakdown">
<action>Review the complete epic breakdown for quality and completeness

Validate:

- All functional requirements from PRD are covered by stories
- Epic 1 establishes proper foundation
- All stories are vertically sliced
- No forward dependencies exist
- Story sizing is appropriate for single-session completion
- BDD acceptance criteria are clear and testable
- Domain/compliance requirements are properly distributed
- Sequencing enables incremental value delivery

Confirm with {user_name}:

- Epic structure makes sense
- Story breakdown is actionable
- Dependencies are clear
- BDD format provides clarity
- Ready for architecture and implementation phases</action>

<template-output>epic_breakdown_summary</template-output>
</step>

</workflow>

# AI CV and Application - Product Requirements Document

**Author:** BIP
**Date:** fredag 21. november 2025
**Version:** 1.0

---

## Executive Summary

AI-powered CV and job application platform to remove job seeker frustrations.

### What Makes This Special

Press a single button and instantly receive a complete, professionally written, tailored CV and cover letter that finally makes them feel confident in their applications.

---

## Project Classification

**Technical Type:** web_app (with api_backend components)
**Domain:** HR Tech / Recruitment
**Complexity:** Medium to High

Multi-part: web_app (frontend), api_backend (backend).

### Domain Context

The platform must comply with GDPR because it processes sensitive personal data such as work history, education, names, contact information, and documents that could reveal protected characteristics. All user data must be encrypted at rest and in transit, stored only within GDPR-compliant regions, and never used for AI training without explicit consent. The system must also support full data deletion upon request, including CVs, job descriptions, and AI-generated content. Fairness in AI outputs is essential because job applications influence peopleâ€™s careers, so the system must avoid amplifying biases related to gender, ethnicity, disability, or age. This means regularly evaluating the LLM outputs for biased phrasing, biased assumptions about work experience, or unequal keyword emphasis. Users must always remain in control, with clear explanations of how the AI made decisions such as match score or extracted keywords. The platform must not fabricate qualifications or rewrite experience in misleading ways, and the user must be able to review and edit every AI-generated sentence before submitting an application. Because external job descriptions often contain copyrighted or proprietary text, the system must avoid storing raw job ads unless absolutely necessary and must delete them automatically after analysis. No external party should ever access a userâ€™s data without consent. Finally, transparency must be built into the design so that users understand how the parsing works, what is stored, and how long it is retained, establishing trust in an environment where personal data is extremely sensitive.

---

## Success Criteria

Users go from lost/stressed to organized/confident/empowered. They experience tangible improvement in application workflow, trusting the app more than manual methods, saving significant time, and getting interviews/job offers. The app becomes their primary tool for job applications.

### Business Metrics

High user retention and voluntary return rate, organic referrals, and a strong correlation between app usage and interview/hire rates.

---

## Product Scope

### MVP - Minimum Viable Product

Frictionless onboarding flow.
Simple way to enter or paste CV information.
Reliable AI parser to extract and structure experience accurately.
Clean CV preview that updates in real time.
Job-matcher that takes a pasted job post and immediately shows:
    Clear, honest match score.
    Missing keywords.
    Strengths and weaknesses.
Generating a polished, downloadable CV and cover letter tailored to a specific job.

### Growth Features (Post-MVP)

Applications history.
Advanced editing tools.
Micro-interactions.
Analytics.

### Vision (Future)

Company-side features.
Premium tiers.

---

## Domain-Specific Requirements

The platform must comply with GDPR because it processes sensitive personal data such as work history, education, names, contact information, and documents that could reveal protected characteristics. All user data must be encrypted at rest and in transit, stored only within GDPR-compliant regions, and never used for AI training without explicit consent. The system must also support full data deletion upon request, including CVs, job descriptions, and AI-generated content. Fairness in AI outputs is essential because job applications influence peopleâ€™s careers, so the system must avoid amplifying biases related to gender, ethnicity, disability, or age. This means regularly evaluating the LLM outputs for biased phrasing, biased assumptions about work experience, or unequal keyword emphasis. Users must always remain in control, with clear explanations of how the AI made decisions such as match score or extracted keywords. The platform must not fabricate qualifications or rewrite experience in misleading ways, and the user must be able to review and edit every AI-generated sentence before submitting an application. Because external job descriptions often contain copyrighted or proprietary text, the system must avoid storing raw job ads unless absolutely necessary and must delete them automatically after analysis. No external party should ever access a userâ€™s data without consent. Finally, transparency must be built into the design so that users understand how the parsing works, what is stored, and how long it is retained, establishing trust in an environment where personal data is extremely sensitive.

This section shapes all functional and non-functional requirements below.

---

## Innovation & Novel Patterns

**Paradigm Inversion:** Shifting from candidate conformity to intelligent candidate-role fit.
**Automated Contextual Tailoring:** Eliminating manual guesswork through data-driven analysis, personalized feedback, and automated document generation.
**Fairness-Driven AI:** Explicitly designing for bias mitigation and equal opportunity for diverse candidate profiles.
**Market Transformation:** Long-term vision to create a more transparent, inclusive, and merit-based hiring ecosystem.

### Validation Approach

Continuous evaluation of AI outputs for fairness and accuracy, A/B testing different tailoring strategies, and rigorous user feedback loops to confirm the "magic moment" and build trust, especially for diverse user groups.

---

## web_app (with api_backend components) Specific Requirements

### API Specification

**Backend/API Requirements:**
*   **Core Principle:** Clear, strict, privacy-first.
*   **Endpoints:** Well-defined for authentication, CV intake/storage, AI parsing, job analysis, tailoring.
*   **Security:** Strong authentication and authorization, all data encrypted in transit and at rest.
*   **GDPR:** Full support for user consent, data export, data correction, permanent deletion.
*   **Logging:** Minimal but sufficient for auditing, no unnecessary personal data.
*   **Scalability:** Stateless where possible.
*   **Abuse Protection:** Rate limiting and abuse protection for expensive AI endpoints.
*   **LLM Integration:** Sandboxed external LLM calls, strict guarantees against using personal data for model training. Prompts must be versioned, deterministic, testable.

### Authentication & Authorization

Strong authentication and authorization rules because every piece of data is highly sensitive. All user data must be encrypted in transit and at rest.

### Platform Support

**Web Application Requirements:**
*   **Core Principle:** Reliability, clarity, trust.
*   **Performance/Responsiveness:** Fast, stable, predictable UI.
*   **Error Handling:** Real-time validation, clear error feedback, graceful handling of slow/failed AI responses.
*   **Data Integrity/UX:** Autosave built-in and frequent; warn users before navigating away with unsaved changes.
*   **Accessibility:** First-class (keyboard nav, contrast, screen-reader compatibility).
*   **AI Transparency/Control:** Users understand how AI outputs are generated, full control (edit, reject, regenerate).
*   **Job-Matching Flow:** Clear loading states, retry options, transparent explanations of match scores and missing keywords.
*   **Monetization/UX:** Honest, non-manipulative separation of free/premium features; free experience not degraded.

---

## User Experience Principles

The user experience should feel clean, calm, intelligent, and immediately clarifying, giving job seekers the sense that their chaotic job search has finally become structured, organized, and manageable. The visual personality should be modern, minimalistic, and trustworthy, with a focus on whitespace, soft colors, and clear hierarchy so users never feel overwhelmed.

### Key Interactions

Interaction patterns must be extremely predictable, with smooth transitions, guided steps, and a constant sense of progress, using progress indicators, inline validation, and instant feedback loops to reinforce confidence. All critical user flowsâ€”from onboarding to CV creation to job matchingâ€”should feel frictionless and require the fewest possible steps, creating that â€œmagic momentâ€ where a user instantly understands what to do next without thinking. Every screen should be optimized for reducing cognitive load, presenting only what is relevant in that moment, and making the experience feel like the platform is gently guiding them forward. The overall UX should empower users to feel in control, supported, and optimistic, delivering a sense of instant clarity and momentum from the very first interaction.

---

## Functional Requirements

The core functional requirements translate directly from the UX principles, scope definition, and MVP vision and define exactly what the system must do to deliver a simple, structured, empowering job-search experience. The platform must allow a user to create an account, authenticate securely, and maintain a persistent session so their CV data is always available. It must allow the user to enter all core CV data through a clean, guided, step-by-step intake flow where each sectionâ€”personal details, work experience, education, skills, and languagesâ€”is captured in a structured format with validation for completeness and correctness. The system must allow the user to edit, reorder, or delete any CV entry instantly with changes immediately reflected in the live preview. The platform must generate a clean, modern, formatted CV based on the structured data using selectable templates and allow the user to download it in PDF or DOCX format. It must allow the user to paste a job description and automatically extract keywords, compare them to the userâ€™s CV, calculate a match score, and show which keywords are present and which are missing. It must allow the user to generate a tailored CV and cover letter that adapts the userâ€™s data to the specific job description while giving the user full control to accept, reject, or edit every AI-generated suggestion. It must save a history of tailored applications so the user can revisit past job matches, CV versions, or cover letters. The system must provide immediate feedback during long operations through loading indicators, skeleton states, and retry options for any failed AI or API process. It must maintain strict data privacy by ensuring user control over stored data, allowing exporting, deleting, and managing personal information. It must offer a visually clear, predictable, minimalistic interface with frictionless navigation, guided flows, and obvious next steps to reinforce momentum and clarity. It must log user interactions and f... [truncated]

---

## Non-Functional Requirements

### Performance

Backend Uptime: Minimum 99% operational availability.
Page Load Times: Frontend page loads within 200â€“500 milliseconds for a responsive user experience.
CV Parsing Speed: CV parsing operations must complete within 2â€“4 seconds to maintain user flow.
System Responsiveness: Overall system must feel consistently responsive and fluid.

### Security

Encryption: All user data (including CVs and job applications) must be encrypted both in transit (e.g., HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (database, file storage).
Authentication & Authorization: Implement strong, role-based authentication and authorization mechanisms for all API endpoints and sensitive data access.
GDPR Compliance: Full adherence to GDPR principles, including explicit user consent for data processing (especially AI training), user rights for data export, correction, and permanent deletion ("right to be forgotten").
LLM Security: External LLM calls must be rigorously sandboxed, with strict, verifiable guarantees that no personal user data is ever used to train or fine-tune models by third-party providers.
Logging: Implement minimal but auditable logging, ensuring no unnecessary or sensitive personal data is persistently stored in logs.
Data Minimization: Raw job advertisement text should only be stored if absolutely necessary and must be automatically deleted after analysis due to potential copyright or proprietary content.
Access Control: No external parties or unauthorized internal personnel shall access user data without explicit, documented consent.

### Scalability

Backend Stateless: Backend components should be designed to be stateless wherever feasible, facilitating horizontal scaling and resilience.
Rate Limiting: Implement robust rate limiting and abuse protection mechanisms for expensive AI processing endpoints to manage load and prevent misuse.

### Accessibility

First-Class Accessibility: The web application must be designed and developed with first-class accessibility, including full keyboard navigation, sufficient color contrast (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance), and comprehensive screen-reader compatibility.
UI Clarity: The user interface must maintain visual clarity, predictability, and a minimalistic design to reduce cognitive load and enhance usability for all users.

---

## Implementation Planning

### Epic Breakdown Required

# Product Brief: AI CV and Application

**Date:** 2025-11-18
**Author:** Kaylee
**Context:** 

---

## Executive Summary

This document outlines the Product Brief for the "AI CV and Application" project, a global, AI-powered platform designed to revolutionize the job search process for students and early-career professionals. The core mission is to eliminate the guesswork and time-consuming manual effort of tailoring job applications, empowering users to secure roles for which they are genuinely qualified.

The platform will address the universal frustration of navigating vague job ads and opaque Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) by providing an intelligent solution that interprets employer intent, automatically tailors a user's CV and cover letter to specific roles, and provides clear, actionable feedback.

The Minimum Viable Product (MVP) will focus on delivering this core value through a simple, streamlined workflow: user authentication, CV intake, AI-powered job ad analysis, and tailored document generation. The go-to-market strategy will begin with a "beachhead" approach in a market like Norway to refine the model before scaling globally. Monetization will be based on a user-centric freemium model, prioritizing trust and value demonstration before introducing a competitively priced premium tier.

Success will be measured by user engagement, retention, and real-world impact (i.e., increased interview callbacks), with a target of delivering the MVP within a 6-week development cycle. This project is positioned to capture a significant opportunity in the growing global market for career tools by offering a demonstrably more effective and user-friendly solution.

---

### Initial Vision

The "AI CV and Application" project envisions a comprehensive, AI-powered platform designed to revolutionize the job search for students and early-career professionals **worldwide**. This platform will address the universal critical pain points of tailoring CVs for specific jobs, navigating ATS systems, and understanding what qualifications truly matter in a diverse global job market.

Leveraging a hybrid AI strategy with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash for cost-effective and superior document analysis and potentially OpenAI GPT-4 for creative tasks, the system will provide:

1.  **Intelligent CV Creation & Management:** Users anywhere can easily input their raw information, which the AI will structure and organize. The platform will offer a wide range of internationally recognized and ATS-friendly templates, with the capability to adapt to regional format conventions (e.g., the Norwegian "Kompetanseprofil") as the platform expands.
2.  **Job-Specific Tailoring & ATS Optimization:** By analyzing job descriptions from any country, the AI will highlight skill gaps, suggest relevant phrasing, and automatically tailor CVs and generate personalized cover letters. A real-time ATS scoring system will provide actionable feedback to maximize a candidate's chances in any market.
3.  **Guided Global Job Search & Career Development:** Beyond document generation, the platform aims to guide users through the global job application process, offering insights into international market trends, skill development pathways, and the cultural nuances of different job markets.

The platform will adopt a freemium model with a generous free tier and a competitively priced premium tier, making it accessible to a global audience. The initial go-to-market strategy may focus on a specific region like Norway to refine the model, but the ultimate goal is to create an empowering and efficient tool that helps job seekers everywhere transform their application process from a frustrating, opaque task into a successful journey.

## Core Vision

### Problem Statement

Job seekers face immense frustration and wasted time due to the constant guesswork involved in tailoring CVs and applications for each job. They lack clear understanding of what employers truly seek and receive almost no feedback on why their applications are rejected or how to improve. This leads to countless hours spent rewriting the same experiences in different ways, attempting to match vague job advertisements and navigate opaque Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) filters, all without knowing if their efforts are effective. This process is a significant time sink, often leaving job seekers feeling disempowered and in the dark about how to successfully present their qualifications.

### Problem Impact

The primary impact of this problem is a significant waste of time and effort for job seekers, leading to frustration and a lack of confidence. Hours are spent on repetitive, manual tailoring of documents, which often yields no positive results or constructive feedback. This "time sink" prevents job seekers from focusing on more strategic aspects of their job hunt, such as skill development or networking. The absence of clear guidance on employer expectations and ATS requirements means that many qualified candidates are overlooked, perpetuating a cycle of rejection and uncertainty.

### Why Existing Solutions Fall Short

Existing solutions largely fail because they do not provide the necessary clarity and actionable feedback job seekers desperately need. Generic resume builders offer templates but don't intelligently adapt content to specific job postings. Manual tailoring is inefficient and prone to error, as job seekers are left to guess what keywords or phrasing will resonate with employers and pass ATS filters. There's a critical lack of tools that can effectively interpret vague job ads, provide real-time insights into employer needs, and then automatically reshape a candidate's experience to meet those specific requirements. The current landscape leaves job seekers "rewriting documents in the dark," without a reliable mechanism to understand if their efforts are aligned with what will actually secure an interview.

### Proposed Solution

The "AI CV and Application" project proposes an intelligent, AI-driven platform that eliminates the guesswork and time-consuming manual effort from the job application process. The solution will interpret job advertisements to clearly identify and highlight the specific requirements, keywords, and underlying expectations of employers for a given role. It will then leverage the user's existing experience and qualifications to dynamically reshape and tailor their CV and cover letter, ensuring the documents "speak the employer's language." This targeted approach will enable job seekers to present their qualifications in the most relevant and impactful way for each application, significantly increasing their chances of passing ATS filters and capturing the attention of hiring managers. By automating the tedious tailoring process and providing clear insights, the platform empowers users to focus on identifying and applying for the right opportunities, rather than endlessly rewriting documents in the dark.

### Key Differentiators

The core differentiation of this solution lies in its ability to provide transparent, actionable insights and automated, intelligent tailoring that goes beyond generic templates. Unlike existing tools that offer limited feedback or require extensive manual input, this platform will:

1.  **Interpret Employer Intent:** Clearly show job seekers "what matters for that role" by dissecting job ads and identifying critical requirements and keywords.
2.  **Intelligent Content Reshaping:** Dynamically adapt and rephrase a user's existing experience to align perfectly with the language and priorities of each specific job posting.
3.  **Feedback-Driven Optimization:** Provide clear guidance and a "match score" to help users understand their alignment with a role and what improvements can be made, effectively closing the feedback loop that is missing in traditional applications.
4.  **Focus on Strategic Application:** Free up job seekers from repetitive document rewriting, allowing them to concentrate on selecting the most suitable jobs and preparing for interviews.

---

## Target Users

### Primary Users

The ideal primary user is the "Exhausted Job Seeker." This individual has been actively applying for jobs for weeks or months and is feeling overwhelmed and demoralized by the process. They are typically students or early-career professionals who spend their evenings and weekends juggling multiple job portals, manually tailoring their CV and cover letter for each application with little to no feedback.

**Their Situation:**
*   They feel stuck in a cycle of rewriting their experience, trying to guess what each employer wants.
*   They are overwhelmed by vague, unrealistic, or buzzword-filled job descriptions.
*   They are unsure if their CV is good enough to pass through ATS filters or impress a recruiter.
*   They waste significant time on manual tailoring, searching for guidance online, and still face rejection without understanding why.

This user is looking for a tool that not only saves them time but also provides the clarity, confidence, and support they need to feel they have a fair chance in the job market. The moment of relief and feeling understood when the platform instantly provides a targeted, professional application is the core value they are seeking.

{{#if secondary_user_segment}}

### Secondary Users

{{secondary_user_segment}}
{{/if}}

### User Journey

The user's journey is a transformation from a state of frustration and uncertainty to one of confidence and efficiency.

**Before:**
1.  **Manual Toil:** The user spends hours manually rewriting their CV and cover letter for each job application.
2.  **Guesswork:** They try to decipher vague job ads and guess which keywords and skills to include.
3.  **Uncertainty:** They submit applications without knowing if they are ATS-compliant or well-targeted.
4.  **Rejection:** They receive little to no feedback, leaving them feeling stuck and demoralized.
5.  **Overwhelm:** The process is a significant time sink, leading to burnout and a lack of focus on strategic job searching.

**After:**
1.  **Effortless Input:** The user provides their raw experience and qualifications once.
2.  **AI-Powered Analysis:** The platform analyzes a target job ad and identifies the key requirements.
3.  **Instant Tailoring:** Within minutes, the AI generates a tailored CV and cover letter that speaks the employer's language.
4.  **Clarity and Confidence:** The user sees a "match score" and clear suggestions, understanding why their application is strong.
5.  **Empowerment:** Freed from manual rewriting, the user can focus on finding the right jobs and preparing for interviews, feeling supported and confident in their applications.

---

## Success Metrics

For the first 6-12 months, success will be defined by genuine user engagement and the product's indispensable role in their job search, rather than solely by financial metrics initially. The primary indicator of success will be user retention and repeated usage, demonstrating that the platform truly makes the job search easier and more effective.

Key success metrics include:
*   **User Retention:** A high percentage of new users not only trying the product once but consistently returning to use it for subsequent job applications.
*   **Completion Rate:** A strong completion rate for the CV intake process, indicating ease of use and value perception.
*   **Activation Rate:** A high percentage of new sign-ups successfully generating at least one tailored application.
*   **Word-of-Mouth Growth:** Organic user acquisition driven by positive recommendations, signaling strong user satisfaction and perceived value.
*   **Real-World Impact:** Tracking whether users consistently receive interview callbacks with applications created by the platform, which directly validates the product's effectiveness in achieving its core promise.
*   **Usage Growth:** Natural increase in platform usage as users progress through their job applications, indicating the product's integration into their routine.

### Business Objectives

The overarching business objective for the initial phase is to establish the "AI CV and Application" as an indispensable tool for job seekers, fostering a highly engaged and retained user base. This involves:
*   **Achieving Product-Market Fit:** Demonstrating that the product genuinely solves a critical pain point for job seekers and is preferred over existing alternatives.
*   **Driving User Engagement & Retention:** Ensuring users consistently return to the platform for their job application needs, indicating its value and ease of use.
*   **Validating Real-World Impact:** Proving that the platform's tailored applications lead to tangible improvements in users' job search outcomes, specifically increased interview callbacks.
*   **Fostering Organic Growth:** Cultivating a product experience so positive that it naturally leads to word-of-mouth referrals and organic user acquisition.

### Key Performance Indicators

To measure progress against these objectives, the following KPIs will be tracked:
*   **Monthly Active Users (MAU):** To gauge the overall reach and sustained engagement with the platform.
*   **CV Intake Completion Rate:** Percentage of new users who successfully complete the initial CV data input process.
*   **Application Generation Rate:** Percentage of users who generate at least one tailored application after completing the CV intake.
*   **Weekly/Monthly Retention Rate:** The proportion of users who return to the platform within a week or month after their initial use, particularly for subsequent job applications.
*   **Interview Callback Rate (Self-Reported/Surveyed):** A qualitative and quantitative measure of how often users receive interview invitations for applications generated by the platform.
*   **Referral Rate/Organic Growth Metrics:** Tracking how many new users are acquired through direct recommendations or non-paid channels.
*   **Usage Frequency:** Monitoring how often active users engage with the application generation and tailoring features.
{{/if}}

---

## MVP Scope

### Core Features

The smallest possible version of the "AI CV and Application" that still proves its core value must enable a user to efficiently generate a tailored CV and cover letter for a specific job. To achieve this, the essential features for the MVP are:

1.  **User Authentication:** Secure user login and account management.
2.  **Simple CV Intake Form:** A guided process for users to input and structure their professional experience, education, and skills.
3.  **AI-Powered Job Ad Analysis:** Functionality to parse a job description (e.g., by pasting text or a link) and intelligently extract key requirements, keywords, and employer expectations.
4.  **Tailored CV Generation:** AI-driven capability to adapt the user's structured CV content to align with the analyzed job description, highlighting relevant experience and phrasing.
5.  **Tailored Cover Letter Generation:** AI-driven capability to create a personalized cover letter that complements the tailored CV and addresses the specific job requirements.

These features are critical because, without them, the product cannot deliver on its promise of making job applications easier and more effective by removing the guesswork and time sink. They form the foundation for proving the core hypothesis.

### Out of Scope for MVP

To maintain focus on the core value proposition and ensure a lean, testable MVP, the following features are explicitly out of scope for the initial release:
*   Advanced dashboards
*   Comprehensive application history tracking
*   A wide variety of multiple templates (beyond a few essential, ATS-friendly options)
*   Portfolio sections
*   Recruiter-facing tools
*   In-depth analytics for users

These features, while valuable, are considered add-ons that can be developed in subsequent iterations once the core hypothesis is validated.

### MVP Success Criteria

The primary goal of the MVP is to unequivocally demonstrate that the core value proposition resonates with users and delivers a tangible benefit. Success will be measured by the MVP's ability to:
*   **Enable Rapid Application Generation:** Users can go from pasting a job ad to having a tailored CV and cover letter within minutes.
*   **Increase User Confidence:** Users report feeling significantly more confident in sending out applications generated by the platform, believing they are accurate, relevant, and speak the employer's language.
*   **Validate Core Hypothesis:** Prove that the AI-driven tailoring removes guesswork and makes the job search process genuinely easier and more effective for early adopters.

{{#if future_vision_features}}

### Future Vision

{{future_vision_features}}
{{/if}}

---

## Market Context

The AI-powered CV and resume builder market is a rapidly growing and competitive global space, with a market size projected to reach $2.88 billion by 2029. The landscape is dominated by a freemium model, with established players increasingly integrating AI as a standard feature.

**Key Global Market Dynamics:**
*   **High User Need:** A significant majority (78.5%) of the market consists of job seekers worldwide, who face universal critical pain points such as high application rejection rates, the time-consuming nature of resume tailoring, and the challenge of optimizing for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).
*   **Competitive Environment:** The market is crowded with over 15 major competitors. Differentiation is crucial, and opportunities exist in providing superior AI-powered features and a user-centric experience that can be adapted to various international markets.
*   **Pricing Norms:** The freemium model is the dominant strategy, with paid tiers typically ranging from $14-19/month. A generous free tier is essential for global user acquisition and to reduce friction.

**Strategic Opportunity & Go-to-Market:**
While the vision is global, the initial go-to-market strategy can leverage a "beachhead" approach by focusing on a specific, underserved market to refine the product before expanding. For example, a market like Norway presents an opportunity due to its high digital adoption and the lack of competitors optimized for local CV conventions.

By proving the model in a controlled environment, the project can build a strong, defensible foundation. The learnings from this initial launchâ€”regarding AI-powered customization, user engagement, and cultural adaptationâ€”can then be applied to a broader international expansion, enabling the "AI CV and Application" project to effectively scale and serve job seekers around the world.

## Financial Considerations

The monetization strategy is designed to prioritize user trust, value demonstration, and organic adoption before focusing on revenue generation.

**Initial Phase (Free Tier):**
*   The platform will initially be free to use, removing any barriers to entry for students, job seekers, and those feeling overwhelmed by the application process.
*   The primary goal of this phase is to build a strong user base, gather real-world usage data to refine the AI models, and allow the product's value to be discovered organically.
*   The free tier will be genuinely useful, allowing users to create a basic CV, analyze one job ad at a time, and generate one tailored application per week.

**Monetization Phase (Premium Tier):**
*   As the platform matures and operational costs increase, a paid tier will be introduced.
*   The pricing will be competitive and fair, benchmarked against services like Jobseeker (approximately 129 NOK/month), with a focus on transparency.
*   The paid tier will offer a meaningful upgrade, providing features such as:
    *   Unlimited CV and cover letter tailoring
    *   Management of multiple CV versions
    *   Access to advanced and premium templates
    *   Application history tracking
    -   Faster processing speeds
*   Revenue is expected to grow gradually, driven by a high volume of users upgrading for the enhanced features, rather than by forcing users into subscriptions early. The balance will be achieved by ensuring the free version is valuable on its own, making the paid version a compelling and justifiable enhancement for active job seekers.

## Technical Preferences

The technical approach for the "AI CV and Application" project is designed for rapid development, scalability, and cost-efficiency, leveraging modern, beginner-friendly technologies.

**Core Technology Stack:**
*   **AI Framework:** Vercel AI SDK will be used to manage interactions with AI providers, enabling features like streaming UI and easy provider switching.
*   **AI Providers:** A dual-provider strategy will be employed, with **Google Gemini 2.5 Flash** as the primary provider for its cost-effectiveness and superior document analysis capabilities. **OpenAI GPT-4** will be available as a fallback or for specific creative tasks like cover letter generation if needed.
*   **Backend:** A modular monolithic backend will be built with **Node.js** and the **Express.js** framework.
*   **Frontend:** The user interface will be developed using **React.js** and styled with **Tailwind CSS**.
*   **Database:** **PostgreSQL**, managed via **Supabase**, will be used for data storage.
*   **Hosting:** The frontend will be hosted on **Vercel**, with the backend deployed on **Render**.

This stack was chosen to align with the project's 6-week development timeline, the team's skill level, and the need for a cost-effective, scalable solution. The Vercel AI SDK, in particular, is expected to accelerate development by 2-3 weeks.

{{#if organizational_context}}

## Organizational Context

{{organizational_context}}
{{/if}}

{{#if risks_and_assumptions}}

## Risks and Assumptions

{{risks_and_assumptions}}
{{/if}}

## Timeline

The project will operate under an agile development approach with a focus on rapid MVP delivery to enable early user feedback and validation of the core hypothesis.

**Key Timeline Constraints:**
*   **MVP Development:** The initial Minimum Viable Product (MVP) is targeted for completion within a **6-week development cycle**. This aggressive timeline is intended to quickly get the core features into the hands of early adopters.
*   **Initial Success Measurement:** The first major review of success metrics (user engagement, retention, activation) will occur within the **first 6-12 months** post-launch. This period will be critical for gathering data, refining the product, and making strategic decisions about monetization and future feature development.

This timeline prioritizes speed to market and learning from real-world user interaction, aligning with the project's goal of building a user-centric and validated solution.

## Supporting Materials

This Product Brief is informed by comprehensive research and analysis across several key domains. The following documents provide the foundational context for the strategic, technical, and user-centric decisions outlined herein:

*   **Market Research (`research-market.md`):** This analysis confirms a significant and growing global market for AI-powered resume builders. It identifies a key strategic opportunity in targeting students and early-career professionals with a freemium model that is optimized for specific regional needs (like the Norwegian market) as a "beachhead" for global expansion. The research validates that user pain points around ATS optimization and time-consuming tailoring are universal.

*   **Technical Research (`research-technical.md`):** This report recommends a specific technology stack chosen for its suitability for rapid MVP development, scalability, and cost-efficiency. The core recommendations include using the Vercel AI SDK with Google Gemini 2.5 as the primary AI provider, a Node.js backend, a React.js frontend, and a PostgreSQL database. This stack is designed to meet the 6-week development timeline.

*   **Prompt Engineering Research (`research-prompt-engineering.md`):** This deep-dive outlines the best practices for interacting with Large Language Models to ensure high-quality, accurate, and culturally appropriate outputs. It emphasizes multi-stage prompt chaining, structured JSON output for reliability, and provider-specific optimization to achieve the desired results for CV analysis, keyword extraction, and cover letter generation.

*   **Brainstorming Session Results (`brainstorming-session-results-*.md`):** These sessions were instrumental in defining the core problem space and user frustrations. Key themes that emerged include the "Job Seeker Information Gap," the poor quality of job postings, and the lack of standardization in skills terminology. The sessions also helped prioritize the core features for the MVP, such as the "Smart Intake System" and the "CV/Application Generator."

---

_It was created through collaborative discovery and reflects the unique needs of this {{context_type}} project._

{{#if next_workflow}}
_Next: {{next_workflow}} will transform this brief into detailed planning artifacts._
{{else}}

{{/if}}

## Proposed Epic Structure

The following epic structure is designed to incrementally build the AI CV and Application platform, focusing on delivering core user value and addressing critical functional and non-functional requirements. Each epic is named to reflect a clear business goal and user value, avoiding purely technical categorizations.

### 1. Epic: Platform Foundation & User Onboarding
**Value Statement:** Establish the core technical infrastructure, secure user authentication, and enable the initial user journey to input and store their essential CV data, forming the bedrock for all subsequent platform capabilities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Project setup, essential tooling, and initial deployment configuration.
*   Core backend and frontend application setup (Node.js/Express.js, React.js/Tailwind CSS).
*   Integration with PostgreSQL database (via Supabase) and ORM.
*   Implementation of secure user registration, login, and session management.
*   Development of a guided, step-by-step form for initial CV data entry (personal details, basic experience/education).
*   Basic data storage for raw CV information.

### 2. Epic: AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview
**Value Statement:** Provide users with comprehensive control over their professional profile data and a real-time, accurate visual representation of their CV, fostering trust and clarity.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Development of a structured internal data model for all CV components (e.g., work experience, education, skills, languages).
*   User interface and API for editing, reordering, and deleting any CV entry.
*   Implementation of a dynamic CV preview feature, allowing users to see changes instantly.
*   Support for selecting basic, ATS-friendly CV templates.
*   Functionality to download the current CV in standard formats (PDF, DOCX).
*   Implementation of autosave functionality and navigation warnings for unsaved changes.

### 3. Epic: Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring
**Value Statement:** Empower users by clearly interpreting job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing actionable insights into their alignment with a role, thus reducing guesswork.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   User interface for pasting job description text.
*   Integration with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash (via Vercel AI SDK) for AI-powered extraction of keywords, required skills, and core responsibilities from job descriptions.
*   Algorithm to compare extracted job requirements against the user's structured CV data.
*   Development of a clear match score display.
*   Feature to highlight missing keywords, user strengths, and areas for improvement based on the job ad analysis.
*   Error handling and loading states for AI processing.

### 4. Epic: Tailored Application Generation
**Value Statement:** Deliver the platform's core promise by automatically crafting highly customized and optimized CVs and cover letters for specific job postings, significantly increasing application effectiveness.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   AI-driven generation of a tailored CV that rephrases and emphasizes relevant experience from the user's profile to align with the specific job ad.
*   AI-driven generation of a personalized cover letter that addresses the job's key requirements and the user's qualifications.
*   User interface for reviewing, accepting, rejecting, or editing every AI-generated suggestion before finalization.
*   Functionality to save a history of all tailored applications, including the job ad, tailored CV, and cover letter.
*   Robust handling of long AI processing times with clear feedback and retry mechanisms.

### 5. Epic: Security, Privacy & Compliance
**Value Statement:** Ensure the platform operates with the highest standards of data security, user privacy, and legal compliance (specifically GDPR), building and maintaining user trust.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Comprehensive implementation of GDPR compliance features (explicit consent, data export, data correction, "right to be forgotten" for all user data).
*   Encryption of all user data (CVs, job applications, personal info) both in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (database, file storage).
*   Implementation of strong, role-based authentication and authorization for all API endpoints and sensitive data access.
*   Rigorous sandboxing of all external LLM calls to prevent personal data from being used for model training.
*   Implementation of minimal, auditable logging practices that avoid storing sensitive personal data.
*   Development of rate limiting and abuse protection for AI processing endpoints.
*   Mechanism for automatic deletion of raw job advertisement text after analysis due to potential copyright concerns.

### Suggested Sequencing

1.  **Platform Foundation & User Onboarding:** Essential for initial user engagement and core technical setup.
2.  **AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview:** Builds upon onboarding by providing users with control over their profile.
3.  **Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring:** Introduces the intelligence layer that informs tailoring.
4.  **Tailored Application Generation:** Delivers the primary value proposition, leveraging all previous steps.
5.  **Security, Privacy & Compliance:** This is an ongoing, cross-cutting concern, but initial implementation and continuous adherence are critical throughout development. A dedicated epic ensures it receives appropriate focus from the outset and beyond.

args.instruction: Update the epic summary in epics.md with the refined version after applying "Critique and Refine" elicitation method.
args.new_string:
## Proposed Epic Structure

The following epic structure is designed to incrementally build the AI CV and Application platform, focusing on delivering core user value and addressing critical functional and non-functional requirements. Each epic is named to reflect a clear business goal and user value, avoiding purely technical categorizations.

### 1. Epic: Platform Foundation & User Onboarding
**Value Statement:** Establish the core technical infrastructure, secure user authentication, and enable the initial user journey to input and store their essential CV data, forming the bedrock for all subsequent platform capabilities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Project setup, essential tooling, and initial deployment configuration.
*   Core backend and frontend application setup (Node.js/Express.js, React.js/Tailwind CSS).
*   Integration with PostgreSQL database (via Supabase) and ORM.
*   Implementation of secure user registration, login, and session management.
*   Development of a guided, step-by-step form for initial CV data entry (personal details, basic experience/education).
*   Basic data storage for raw CV information.

### 2. Epic: AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview
**Value Statement:** Provide users with comprehensive control over their professional profile data and a real-time, accurate visual representation of their CV, fostering trust and clarity. This enables users to meticulously craft and refine their core professional story.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Development of a structured internal data model for all CV components (e.g., work experience, education, skills, languages).
*   User interface and API for editing, reordering, and deleting any CV entry.
*   Implementation of a dynamic CV preview feature, allowing users to see changes instantly.
*   Support for selecting basic, ATS-friendly CV templates.
*   Functionality to download the current CV in standard formats (PDF, DOCX).
*   Implementation of autosave functionality and navigation warnings for unsaved changes.

### 3. Epic: Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring
**Value Statement:** Empower users by clearly interpreting job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing actionable insights into their alignment with a role, thus reducing guesswork and guiding their application strategy. This helps users quickly identify best-fit opportunities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   User interface for pasting job description text.
*   Integration with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash (via Vercel AI SDK) for AI-powered extraction of keywords, required skills, and core responsibilities from job descriptions.
*   Algorithm to compare extracted job requirements against the user's structured CV data.
*   Calculation and display of a clear match score display.
*   Feature to highlight missing keywords, user strengths, and areas for improvement based on the job ad analysis.
*   Error handling and loading states for AI processing.

### 4. Epic: Tailored Application Generation
**Value Statement:** Deliver the platform's core promise by automatically crafting highly customized and optimized CVs and cover letters for specific job postings, significantly increasing application effectiveness and user confidence. This directly translates into higher interview rates.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   AI-driven generation of a tailored CV that rephrases and emphasizes relevant experience from the user's profile to align with the specific job ad.
*   AI-driven generation of a personalized cover letter that addresses the job's key requirements and the user's qualifications.
*   User interface for reviewing, accepting, rejecting, or editing every AI-generated suggestion before finalization.
*   Functionality to save a history of all tailored applications, including the job ad, tailored CV, and cover letter.
*   Robust handling of long AI processing times with clear feedback and retry mechanisms.

### 5. Epic: Trust & Data Governance (Cross-Cutting Concern)
**Value Statement:** Ensure the platform operates with the highest standards of data security, user privacy, and legal compliance (specifically GDPR), building and maintaining unwavering user trust. This is foundational to the platform's viability.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Comprehensive implementation of GDPR compliance features (explicit consent, data export, data correction, "right to be forgotten" for all user data).
*   Encryption of all user data (CVs, job applications, personal info) both in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (database, file storage).
*   Implementation of strong, role-based authentication and authorization for all API endpoints and sensitive data access.
*   Rigorous sandboxing of all external LLM calls to prevent personal data from being used for model training.
*   Implementation of minimal, auditable logging practices that avoid storing sensitive personal data.
*   Development of rate limiting and abuse protection for AI processing endpoints.
*   Mechanism for automatic deletion of raw job advertisement text after analysis due to potential copyright concerns.
*   **Clarification:** This epic focuses on the overarching framework, policies, and specialized features for security, privacy, and compliance. Specific security and compliance stories relevant to other functional areas will be integrated into those respective epics to ensure security is built-in, not bolted on.

### Suggested Sequencing

1.  **Platform Foundation & User Onboarding:** Essential for initial user engagement and core technical setup.
2.  **AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview:** Builds upon onboarding by providing users with control over their profile.
3.  **Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring:** Introduces the intelligence layer that informs tailoring.
4.  **Tailored Application Generation:** Delivers the primary value proposition, leveraging all previous steps.
5.  **Trust & Data Governance:** This epic primarily defines the overarching security and compliance framework and specialized features. Implementation of security and compliance requirements will be integrated into all other epics as a cross-cutting concern from their inception.

4.  **Tailored Application Generation:** Delivers the primary value proposition, leveraging all previous steps.
5.  **Trust & Data Governance:** This epic primarily defines the overarching security and compliance framework and specialized features. Implementation of security and compliance requirements will be integrated into all other epics as a cross-cutting concern from their inception.
args.old_string:
## Proposed Epic Structure

The following epic structure is designed to incrementally build the AI CV and Application platform, focusing on delivering core user value and addressing critical functional and non-functional requirements. Each epic is named to reflect a clear business goal and user value, avoiding purely technical categorizations.

### 1. Epic: Platform Foundation & User Onboarding
**Value Statement:** Establish the core technical infrastructure, secure user authentication, and enable the initial user journey to input and store their essential CV data, forming the bedrock for all subsequent platform capabilities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Project setup, essential tooling, and initial deployment configuration.
*   Core backend and frontend application setup (Node.js/Express.js, React.js/Tailwind CSS).
*   Integration with PostgreSQL database (via Supabase) and ORM.
*   Implementation of secure user registration, login, and session management.
*   Development of a guided, step-by-step form for initial CV data entry (personal details, basic experience/education).
*   Basic data storage for raw CV information.

### 2. Epic: AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview
**Value Statement:** Provide users with comprehensive control over their professional profile data and a real-time, accurate visual representation of their CV, fostering trust and clarity. This enables users to meticulously craft and refine their core professional story.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Development of a structured internal data model for all CV components (e.g., work experience, education, skills, languages).
*   User interface and API for editing, reordering, and deleting any CV entry.
*   Implementation of a dynamic CV preview feature, allowing users to see changes instantly.
*   Support for selecting basic, ATS-friendly CV templates.
*   Functionality to download the current CV in standard formats (PDF, DOCX).
*   Implementation of autosave functionality and navigation warnings for unsaved changes.

### 3. Epic: Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring
**Value Statement:** Empower users by clearly interpreting job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing actionable insights into their alignment with a role, thus reducing guesswork and guiding their application strategy. This helps users quickly identify best-fit opportunities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   User interface for pasting job description text.
*   Integration with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash (via Vercel AI SDK) for AI-powered extraction of keywords, required skills, and core responsibilities from job descriptions.
*   Algorithm to compare extracted job requirements against the user's structured CV data.
*   Calculation and display of a clear match score display.
*   Feature to highlight missing keywords, user strengths, and areas for improvement based on the job ad analysis.
*   Error handling and loading states for AI processing.

### 4. Epic: Tailored Application Generation
**Value Statement:** Deliver the platform's core promise by automatically crafting highly customized and optimized CVs and cover letters for specific job postings, significantly increasing application effectiveness and user confidence. This directly translates into higher interview rates.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   AI-driven generation of a tailored CV that rephrases and emphasizes relevant experience from the user's profile to align with the specific job ad.
*   AI-driven generation of a personalized cover letter that addresses the job's key requirements and the user's qualifications.
*   User interface for reviewing, accepting, rejecting, or editing every AI-generated suggestion before finalization.
*   Functionality to save a history of all tailored applications, including the job ad, tailored CV, and cover letter.
*   Robust handling of long AI processing times with clear feedback and retry mechanisms.

### 5. Epic: Security, Privacy & Compliance
**Value Statement:** Ensure the platform operates with the highest standards of data security, user privacy, and legal compliance (specifically GDPR), building and maintaining unwavering user trust.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Comprehensive implementation of GDPR compliance features (explicit consent, data export, data correction, "right to be forgotten" for all user data).
*   Encryption of all user data (CVs, job applications, personal info) both in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (database, file storage).
*   Implementation of strong, role-based authentication and authorization for all API endpoints and sensitive data access.
*   Rigorous sandboxing of all external LLM calls to prevent personal data from being used for model training.
*   Implementation of minimal, auditable logging practices that avoid storing sensitive personal data.
*   Development of rate limiting and abuse protection for AI processing endpoints.
*   Mechanism for automatic deletion of raw job advertisement text after analysis due to potential copyright concerns.

### Suggested Sequencing

1.  **Platform Foundation & User Onboarding:** Essential for initial user engagement and core technical setup.
2.  **AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview:** Builds upon onboarding by providing users with control over their profile.
3.  **Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring:** Introduces the intelligence layer that informs tailoring.
4.  **Tailored Application Generation:** Delivers the primary value proposition, leveraging all previous steps.
5.  **Security, Privacy & Compliance:** This is an ongoing, cross-cutting concern, but initial implementation and continuous adherence are critical throughout development. A dedicated epic ensures it receives appropriate focus from the outset and beyond.

## Proposed Epic Structure

The following epic structure is designed to incrementally build the AI CV and Application platform, focusing on delivering core user value and addressing critical functional and non-functional requirements. Each epic is named to reflect a clear business goal and user value, avoiding purely technical categorizations.

### 1. Epic: Platform Foundation & User Onboarding
**Value Statement:** Establish the core technical infrastructure, secure user authentication, and enable the initial user journey to input and store their essential CV data, forming the bedrock for all subsequent platform capabilities.

**Value Statement:** Provide users with comprehensive control over their professional profile data and a real-time, accurate visual representation of their CV, fostering trust and clarity. This enables users to meticulously craft and refine their core professional story.

**Value Statement:** Empower users by clearly interpreting job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing actionable insights into their alignment with a role, thus reducing guesswork and guiding their application strategy. This helps users quickly identify best-fit opportunities.

*   Feature to highlight missing keywords, user strengths, and areas for improvement based on the job ad analysis.
*   Error handling and loading states for AI processing.

### 4. Epic: Tailored Application Generation
**Value Statement:** Deliver the platform's core promise by automatically crafting highly customized and optimized CVs and cover letters for specific job postings, significantly increasing application effectiveness and user confidence. This directly translates into higher interview rates.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   AI-driven generation of a tailored CV that rephrases and emphasizes relevant experience from the user's profile to align with the specific job ad.
*   AI-driven generation of a personalized cover letter that addresses the job's key requirements and the user's qualifications.

Specific security and compliance stories relevant to other functional areas will be integrated into those respective epics to ensure security is built-in, not bolted on.

# ibe160 - Epic Breakdown

**Author:** BIP
**Date:** lÃ¸rdag 22. november 2025
**Project Level:** {{project_level}}
**Target Scale:** {{target_scale}}

---

## Overview

This document provides the complete epic and story breakdown for ibe160, decomposing the requirements from the [PRD](./PRD.md) into implementable stories.

## Proposed Epic Structure

The following epic structure is designed to incrementally build the AI CV and Application platform, focusing on delivering core user value and addressing critical functional and non-functional requirements. Each epic is named to reflect a clear business goal and user value, avoiding purely technical categorizations.

### 1. Epic: Platform Foundation & User Onboarding
**Value Statement:** Establish the core technical infrastructure, secure user authentication, and enable the initial user journey to input and store their essential CV data, forming the bedrock for all subsequent platform capabilities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Project setup, essential tooling, and initial deployment configuration.
*   Core backend and frontend application setup (Node.js/Express.js, React.js/Tailwind CSS).
*   Integration with PostgreSQL database (via Supabase) and ORM.
*   Implementation of secure user registration, login, and session management.
*   Development of a guided, step-by-step form for *basic profile creation (e.g., name, contact) to enable account setup*.
*   Basic data storage for raw CV information.

### 2. Epic: AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview
**Value Statement:** Provide users with comprehensive control over their professional profile data and a real-time, accurate visual representation of their CV, fostering trust and clarity. This enables users to meticulously craft and refine their core professional story.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Development of a structured internal data model for all CV components (e.g., work experience, education, skills, languages).
*   User interface and API for editing, reordering, and deleting any CV entry.
*   Implementation of a dynamic CV preview feature, allowing users to see changes instantly.
*   Support for selecting basic, ATS-friendly CV templates.
*   Functionality to download the current CV in standard formats (PDF, DOCX).
*   Implementation of autosave functionality and navigation warnings for unsaved changes.

### 3. Epic: Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring
**Value Statement:** Empower users by clearly interpreting job descriptions, identifying key requirements, and providing actionable insights into their alignment with a role, thus reducing guesswork and guiding their application strategy. This helps users quickly identify best-fit opportunities.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   User interface for pasting job description text.
*   Integration with Google Gemini 2.5 Flash (via Vercel AI SDK) for AI-powered extraction of keywords, required skills, and core responsibilities from job descriptions.
*   Algorithm to compare extracted job requirements against the user's structured CV data.
*   Calculation and display of a clear match score display.
*   Feature to highlight missing keywords, user strengths, and areas for improvement based on the job ad analysis.
*   Error handling and loading states for AI processing.

### 4. Epic: Tailored Application Generation
**Value Statement:** Deliver the platform's core promise by automatically crafting highly customized and optimized CVs and cover letters for specific job postings, significantly increasing application effectiveness and user confidence. This directly translates into higher interview rates.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   AI-driven generation of a tailored CV that rephrases and emphasizes relevant experience from the user's profile to align with the specific job ad.
*   AI-driven generation of a personalized cover letter that addresses the job's key requirements and the user's qualifications.
*   User interface for reviewing, accepting, rejecting, or editing every AI-generated suggestion before finalization.
*   Functionality to save a history of all tailored applications, including the job ad, tailored CV, and cover letter.
*   Robust handling of long AI processing times with clear feedback and retry mechanisms.

### 5. Epic: Trust & Data Governance (Cross-Cutting Concern)
**Value Statement:** Ensure the platform operates with the highest standards of data security, user privacy, and legal compliance (specifically GDPR), building and maintaining unwavering user trust. This is foundational to the platform's viability.

**High-Level Scope:**
*   Comprehensive implementation of GDPR compliance features (explicit consent, data export, data correction, "right to be forgotten" for all user data).
*   Encryption of all user data (CVs, job applications, personal info) both in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (database, file storage).
*   Implementation of strong, role-based authentication and authorization for all API endpoints and sensitive data access.
*   Rigorous sandboxing of all external LLM calls to prevent personal data from being used for model training.
*   Implementation of minimal, auditable logging practices that avoid storing sensitive personal data.
*   Development of rate limiting and abuse protection for AI processing endpoints.
*   Mechanism for automatic deletion of raw job advertisement text after analysis due to potential copyright concerns.
*   **Clarification:** This epic focuses on the overarching framework, policies, and specialized features for security, privacy, and compliance. Specific security and compliance stories relevant to other functional areas will be integrated into those respective epics to ensure security is built-in, not bolted on.

### Suggested Sequencing

1.  **Platform Foundation & User Onboarding:** Essential for initial user engagement and core technical setup.
2.  **AI-Powered CV Data Management & Preview:** Builds upon onboarding by providing users with control over their profile.
3.  **Job Ad Analysis & Match Scoring:** Introduces the intelligence layer that informs tailoring.
4.  **Tailored Application Generation:** Delivers the primary value proposition, leveraging all previous steps.
5.  **Trust & Data Governance:** This epic primarily defines the overarching security and compliance framework and specialized features. Implementation of security and compliance requirements will be integrated into all other epics as a cross-cutting concern from their inception.

---

<!-- Repeat for each epic (N = 1, 2, 3...) -->
